intro: Commiphora montana, commonly known as the mountain myrrh, is a small evergreen shrub native to the mountainous regions of East Africa. It belongs to the Burseraceae family, which includes frankincense and myrrh-producing species. The plant is characterized by its aromatic, resinous bark and small, leathery leaves. It produces yellowish-white flowers and small, dark berries that are dispersed by birds. Due to its unique properties, it has been used traditionally for its medicinal and aromatic qualities.
